reviewText: 05/15/14Viewed "Screaming Skull" and found it to be a very good print, better than two other poor DVD copies I own. Bright, reasonably clear, with only a few minor quick blemishes. Appears complete with no splices/missing frames, and no reel marker/burn marks typically found on the public domain/TV syndicated copies. I had to turn up the volume a little on the audio. It has the "Orion" pictures credit at the beginning, and the MGM Lion logo at the end. Appears to be as promised, a genuine studio supplied print used for this DVD.I also viewed "Vampire Lovers" and found it to be a very good print as well. I don't have any other DVD to compare it to, but it is a clean, bright, blemish free widescreen print with strong audio. Had to turn down my audio volume below the average setting. Shamefully admit I had never seen this movie before. I've been a fan of Ingrid Pitt since enjoying her cleavage and eastern European beauty in the war movie "Where Eagles Dare". Imagine my delight with all the nudity of her in this movie. It quickly won me over!Recommended buy.
summary: Worth it for a nice copy of Screaming Skull alone
Title: Movies 4 You: Horror

reviewText: they are all goodalot of fun and great for parties.if you have some the titles on bluray and don't want pull them out to watch them, then it's great to have this copy for a knock around.
summary: skull is remastered. the best you will ever see it.
Title: Movies 4 You: Horror

reviewText: due to house being replaced I saved money. it was ONLY reason for me to buy this release.too bad.
summary: WAS going to buy, not now.
Title: Movies 4 You: Horror

reviewText: This is by far the best transfer of The Screaming Skull out there, complete with the Peggy Webber bra scene missing from some versions. The image is nice and sharp. The sound, however, isn't the greatest but maybe it never was to begin with. Too bad the movie isn't better but it is fun if you are in an undemanding mood. I checked out The Vampire Lovers and although the transfer is good the music has an annoying warble which thankfully isn't on the MGM Midnight Movies DVD of this title. I still wish that The House That Screamed could have been included as it would have made the disc far more worthwhile.
Title: Movies 4 You: Horror

reviewText: While this upcoming release will sport a remastered SCREAMING SKULL, many fans were hoping for the 1st official English release of the excellent Spanish Gothic HOUSE THAT SCREAMED.  There is most certainly a market for this film to be remastered and released, preferably on Blu Ray.  Please give it some serious consideration.  Replacing the highly sought after HOUSE with the commonly available VAMPIRE LOVERS is akin to a facekick to the market for these films, along with squeezing 4 films onto a single sided 8 gig disc.
summary: Please MGM / Sony remaster HOUSE THAT SCREAMED
Title: Movies 4 You: Horror

reviewText: Just to let you know. the house that screamed you can get in the pure terror 50 movie pack from mill creek. And it's under $10
Title: Movies 4 You: Horror

reviewText: I like these sets and for the price, one can't really complain! I don't have The Bat People or a decent print of Screaming Skull, so for me this is an essential DVD purchase, more of these sets please?
Title: Movies 4 You: Horror

reviewText: For those of you who are buying this disc for The Screaming Skull, it is what you've been waiting for. The image is crisp. And during the last ten minutes the sound went out of sync. I have to say that I didn't care a whole lot as I don't believe I ever want to see it again. The quality of the image on the other three titles is equally good.
summary: AT LAST! A DECENT COPY OF THE SCREAMING SKULL
Title: Movies 4 You: Horror

reviewText: As with several others I long for a decent release of THE SCREAMING SKULL, my major reason to purchase this set. And having both THE VAMPIRE and THE VAMPIRE LOVERS on flipper discs, I'm ok with their release on this single sided disc. BAT PEOPLE I've managed to avoid until now, so that's ok too. Hopefully THE HOUSE THAT SCREAMED will be forthcoming, along with many other such bargain sets from SHOUTFACTORY/TIMELESS which always have better public domain releases than the ones I constantly need to upgrade...Keep 'em coming!
Title: Movies 4 You: Horror

reviewText: After tempting horror fans with a possibly legitimate release of the horror Holy Grail, HOUSE THAT SCREAMED, Timeless Media/Shout Factory dumps it in favor of VAMPIRE LOVERS. There is nothing wrong with VAMPIRE LOVERS except that its been readily available on DVD and Blu-ray for years, while the much sought after HOUSE THE SCREAMED has never enjoyed a decent release to any format.I know it's annoying when people give a negative review to a disk before it even comes out, but there has been so much buzz about the video debut of HOUSE THAT SCREAMED, that this will probably prove to be a deal-breaker for a lot of buyers.
Title: Movies 4 You: Horror
